importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott went missing on this date after leaving an overnight shift at an assisted living facility. The stolen vehicle incident and her disappearance are tied to this timeline.
The remains of Kada Scott were discovered on this date, and authorities confirmed her identity through DNA testing. This marks a critical turning point in the investigation.
The black Hyundai Accent was reported stolen the day before Scott went missing and was later found on fire, linking it to King’s suspected involvement in her disappearance.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeline begins with the reported theft of the Hyundai Accent and Scott’s disappearance, which occurred on the same day, establishing a direct link between King’s actions and Scott’s fate.

keyTakeAways: Remains of missing 23-year-old Kada Scott were found behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia in a shallow grave, confirmed by DNA testing.

Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, was arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, causing or risking a catastrophe, conspiracy, and possibly homicide after being linked to Scott’s disappearance via cellphone activity and vehicle evidence.
A stolen black Hyundai Accent, reported stolen on October 4, was seen parked near where Scott’s body was found and later burned at a junkyard, with video evidence suggesting King’s involvement.
An anonymous tip led investigators to re-examine the abandoned school site, where the remains were discovered, indicating a critical role of public information in solving a missing persons case.
Prosecutors say further charges are being considered, including homicide, and that other individuals may have been involved in the incident, which remains under active investigation.
Kada Scott, who worked in an assisted living facility, was remembered by her parents as a source of light and kindness; her family expressed deep emotional pain over her disappearance and death.

namedEntities.name: Kada Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 23-year-old woman who went missing in Philadelphia and whose remains were found behind an abandoned school.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Her disappearance and subsequent identification through DNA are central to the case, driving the investigation and public attention.

namedEntities.name: Keon King
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and possible homicide in connection with Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the primary suspect linked to Scott’s disappearance through cellphone tracking, vehicle evidence, and prior criminal history.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The city where Kada Scott went missing and where the remains were discovered and the investigation is currently taking place.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The location of the crime and the jurisdiction of the investigation places this case within the city’s law enforcement and legal system, affecting public trust and response.

namedEntities.name: Abandoned school
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A location behind which the remains of Kada Scott were found, located in Philadelphia.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The site is significant as it was the location of the discovery, suggesting possible concealment or a pattern of criminal activity in a remote, unmonitored area.

namedEntities.name: Black Hyundai Accent
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A stolen vehicle found on fire and previously seen parked near where Scott’s body was discovered.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It serves as key physical evidence linking Keon King to the crime and supports allegations of arson and vehicle theft related to Scott’s disappearance.

namedEntities.name: District Attorney Larry Krasner
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The Philadelphia prosecutor who stated that homicide charges may be pursued and emphasized legal procedures in the investigation.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the official responsible for leading the prosecution and making key legal decisions about charges and whether homicide should be pursued.

namedEntities.name: Ashley Toczylowski
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A prosecutor who provided detailed evidence of cellphone tracking, video footage, and tip-based investigation progress.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is a key source of operational updates, including the role of anonymous tips and video evidence in locating the remains.

namedEntities.name: Dover, Delaware
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The hometown of Keon King, located in Delaware.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It provides context for King’s background and possible regional ties to the crime, though his arrest is in Philadelphia.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In Philadelphia, the remains of 23-year-old missing woman Kada Scott were found behind an abandoned school after an anonymous tip prompted investigators to re-examine the site. DNA tests confirmed her identity. Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and possibly homicide. Evidence includes cellphone tracking, video footage showing King’s vehicle (a stolen black Hyundai Accent) parked near the site, and the car being later found on fire. Prosecutors say more charges are under consideration and that others may have been involved. The case highlights the role of public tips, digital evidence, and ongoing investigations into missing persons and violent crimes.
title: Remains found behind abandoned school belong to missing Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, officials say
